contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Mary, who gave birth to Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Mary, by whom Jesus was born

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what the Lord told the prophet Isaiah to write long ago" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "this is what the prophet wrote long ago" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this is what was written by the prophet

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "This fulfilled" or "Herod's actions fulfilled" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then was fulfilled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People heard a voice" or "There was a loud sound" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A voice was heard

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one could comfort her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: she refused to be comforted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what the Lord spoke long ago through the prophets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what had been spoken through the prophets

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so John could baptize him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be baptized by John

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "After John baptized Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: After he was baptized

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jesus saw the sky open" or "God opened the heavens to Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the heavens were opened to him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Spirit led Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Jesus was led up by the Spirit

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses wrote this in the scriptures long ago" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for the writer wrote in the scriptures" or "for it says in the scriptures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: for it is written

contextId.information: It is understood that Jesus is quoting scripture again. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Again, I will tell you what Moses wrote in the scriptures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Again it is written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the king had arrested John" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: John had been arrested

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what God said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what was said

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the demon-possessed" or "those whom demons control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those possessed by demons

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "those people whom others treat unfairly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who have been persecuted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will call that person" or "God will call them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God told our ancestors long ago" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it was said to them in ancient times

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "First make peace with the person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: First be reconciled with your brother

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the officer might put you in prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you may be thrown into prison

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "than for God to throw your whole body into hell" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: than that your whole body should be thrown into hell

contextId.information: God is the one who "said." Jesus uses the passive here to make it plain that it is not God or God's word that he disagrees with. Rather, he is saying that a divorce is just only if it occurs for the right reason. A divorce can be unjust even if the man obeys the command to give a written notice. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was also said

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "her after her husband has divorced her" or "the divorced woman" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: her after she has been divorced

contextId.information: Jesus makes it plain here that he agrees with God and his word. But, he is telling his hearers not to use what does not belong to them to try to make people believe their words. AT: "your religious leaders have said to you that God told ... false oath" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you have heard that it was said ... false oath

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "their false gods will hear them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they will be heard

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "did not wear clothes that are as beautiful as these lilies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was not clothed like one of these

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will not condemn you harshly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will not be judged

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will condemn you in the same way you condemn others" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: with the judgment you judge, you will be judged

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will measure it out to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be measured out to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will give you what you need" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be given to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will open it for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be opened to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he built it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it was built

contextId.information: The result of Jesus saying "Be clean" was that the man was healed. This can be stated in active form. AT: "he was well" or "the leprosy left him" or "the leprosy ended" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was cleansed of his leprosy

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "who is under the authority of someone else" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who is placed under authority

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will throw the sons of the kingdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the sons of the kingdom will be thrown

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so I will do it for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so may it be done for you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jesus fulfilled the prophecy that the prophet Isaiah had spoken to the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was fulfilled that which had been spoken by Isaiah the prophet

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "a powerful storm arose on the sea" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: there arose a great storm on the sea

contextId.information: It is implied that the disciples were with Jesus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Jesus entered a boat

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I have forgiven your sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Your sins have been forgiven

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the bridegroom will not be able to be with them any longer" or "someone will take the bridegroom away from them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the bridegroom will be taken away from them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and this will make the tear worse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and a worse tear will be made

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and this will ruin the wineskin and spill the wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the wine will be spilled, and the wineskins will be destroyed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "this will keep safe both the wineskin and the wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: both will be preserved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "After Jesus had sent the crowd outside" or "After the family had sent the people outside" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When the crowd had been put outside

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will do as you have believed" or "Because you believe, I will heal you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let it be done to you according to your faith

contextId.information: This means they were able to see. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God healed their eyes" or "the two blind men were able to see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: their eyes were opened

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone brought a mute man ... to Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a mute man ... was brought to Jesus

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom a demon had possessed" or "whom a demon was controlling" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: possessed by a demon

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "This has never happened before" or "No one has ever done anything like this before" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This has never been seen

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they will bring you" or "they will drag you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be brought

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "and have them put to death" or "and have the authorities execute them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and cause them to be put to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will deliver that person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that person will be saved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God knows even how many hairs are on your head" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: even the hairs of your head are all numbered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I am healing lepers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: lepers are being cleansed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I am telling needy people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: needy people are being told

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "This is what the prophet Malachi wrote long ago about John the Baptist" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This is he of whom it was written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "My Father has entrusted all things to me" or "My Father has given everything over to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: All things have been entrusted to me from my Father

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "it was healthy again" or "it became well again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it was restored to health

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Then someone brought to Jesus a man who was blind and mute because a demon was controlling him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then someone blind and mute, possessed by a demon, was brought to Jesus

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will forgive every sin that people commit and every evil thing they say" or "God will forgive every person who sins or says evil things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will forgive a person for that" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that will be forgiven him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people know whether a tree is good or bad by looking at its fruit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a tree is recognized by its fruit

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the unclean spirit finds that someone has swept the house clean and has put everything in the house where it belongs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it finds that house swept out and put in order

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the sun scorched the plants, and they became too hot" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they were scorched

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form: AT: "the message that God sowed in his heart" or "the message that he heard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what has been sown in his heart

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The people of Jesus' hometown took offense at him" or "The people rejected Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They were offended by him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "After her mother instructed her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: After being instructed by her mother

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Her request made the king very upset" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The king was very upset by her request

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he ordered his men to do what she said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he ordered that it should be done

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "until they were full" or "until they were no longer hungry" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and were filled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "became well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: were healed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "this statement made the Pharisees angry" or "this statement offended the Pharisees" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the Pharisees were offended when they heard this statement

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "my Father will uproot them" or "my Father will take them out of the ground" or "my Father will remove them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be rooted up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "a demon is tormenting my daughter very much" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: My daughter is severely tormented by a demon

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God did not send me to anyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I was not sent to anyone

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: let it be done

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jesus healed her daughter" or "her daughter became well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: her daughter was healed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "on the third day, God would make him alive again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: be raised back to life on the third day

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God completely changed Jesus' appearance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He was transfigured

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone will deliver the Son of Man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The Son of Man will be delivered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT:"God will raise him up" or "he will come back to life again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he will be raised up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "if someone put a great millstone around his neck and threw him into the deep sea" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a great millstone should be hung about his neck, and that he should be sunk into the depths of the sea

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "than to have both hands and feet when God throws you into the eternal fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: than to be thrown into the eternal fire having two hands or two feet

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "than to have both eyes when God throws you into the eternal fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: than to be thrown into the eternal fire having both eyes

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone brought one of the king's servant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: one servant was brought

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the king commanded his servants to sell the man ... and to pay the debt with the money from the sale" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: his master commanded him to be sold ... and payment to be made

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the first servant owed the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was owed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "some people brought little children to Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: some little children were brought to him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will raise him up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he will be raised up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "my Father has prepared those places, and he will give them to whom he chooses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it is for those for whom it has been prepared by my Father

contextId.information: You can state this in active form. AT: "a donkey that someone has tied up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a donkey tied up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "this happened so that Jesus would fulfill what God spoke through the prophet long ago" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this came about that what was spoken through the prophet might be fulfilled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The prophets wrote long ago" or "God said long ago" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the people the king had invited" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who had been invited

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "So the guests filled the wedding hall" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: So the wedding hall was filled with guests

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For God invites many people, but he only chooses a few" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For many people are called, but few are chosen

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "nor will people give their children in marriage" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: nor are given in marriage

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They do all their deeds so that people can see what they do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They do all their deeds to be seen by people

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for people to call them 'Rabbi'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be called 'Rabbi' by people

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "But you must not let anyone call you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: But you must not be called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will humble" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be humbled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Do not let these things trouble you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: See that you are not troubled

contextId.information: Here "nations" refers to the people of nations. This can be stated in active form. AT: "People from every nation will hate you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: You will be hated by all the nations

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people will sin more and more" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: iniquity will be multiplied

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will deliver that person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be saved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "about which Daniel the prophet wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: which was spoken of by Daniel the prophet

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will make the sun dark" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the sun will be darkened

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and he would not have allowed anyone to get into his house to steal things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and would not have allowed his house to be broken into

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "My master is slow to return" or "My master will not return for a long time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: My master has been delayed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "while the bridegroom was taking a long time to arrive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: while the bridegroom was delayed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will give him more" or "I will give him more" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: more will be given

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the eternal fire that God has prepared" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the eternal fire that has been prepared

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "some men will give the Son of Man to other people who will crucify him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "wherever people preach this gospel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: wherever this gospel is preached

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "just as the prophets wrote about him in the scriptures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: just as it is written about him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "will soon flow out of my body" or "will flow out of my wounds when I die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: is poured out

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "may what you want happen" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: your will be done

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and someone is betraying the Son of Man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and the Son of Man is being betrayed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the Jewish leaders had condemned Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that Jesus had been condemned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people call that field" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that field has been called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "This fulfilled what the prophet Jeremiah spoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then that which had been spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "prisoner whom the crowd would choose" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: prisoner chosen by the crowd

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the crowd gathered" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they were gathered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and Pilate ordered his soldiers to crucify Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: handed him over to be crucified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "place that people called Golgotha" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: place called Golgotha

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The soldiers crucified two robbers with Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Two robbers were crucified with him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the robbers that the soldiers had crucified with Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the robbers who were crucified with him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the curtain of the temple tore in two" or "God caused the curtain of the temple to tear in two" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the curtain of the temple was split in two

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Then Pilate ordered the soldiers to give the body of Jesus to Joseph" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then Pilate ordered it to be given to him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom the people and the soldiers crucified" or "whom they crucified" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who has been crucified

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "did what the priests had told them to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: did as they had been instructed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "My Father has given me all authority" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: All authority has been given to me
